title: ESO readies for low summer demand with new Optional Downward Flexibility Management consultation
lead: ​The Optional Downward Flexibility Management (ODFM) service is to be reinstated this summer, with National Grid ESO now consulting on its terms and conditions.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Brexit has reduced trading with Ireland sending power prices ‘rocketing’
lead: ​Brexit has led to reduced trading over Irish electricity interconnectors and increased the frequency of extreme prices .
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Wind generation hits new peak amidst Beast from the East 2
lead: ​Wind generation has smashed yet another record, hitting a new generation high of 17.5GW this weekend.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: PODCAST: The changing shape of energy flexibility, solar and energy storage enter new phases
lead: The latest episode of the Solar Media Podcast is now available stream, exploring how energy flexibility is changing in the UK and beyond.
author: Current± Staff

title: Elexon calls for ‘holistic reform’ of system operator roles and code arrangements
lead: ​Elexon has thrown its weight behind a reorganisation of both the system operator (SO) roles and code arrangements to develop a ‘holistic’ system that can support net zero.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Centrica unveils plans to install 78 heat pumps in council partnership
lead: ​Centrica is to install heat pumps and other low carbon technology at 78 homes in East Devon over the next month.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Octopus partners NatWest for EV charger finance solution
lead: ​Octopus Energy has partnered NatWest to offer electric vehicle (EV) charger financing to all of the latter’s personal, business and wealth customers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: BP joins IBM Quantum Network to advance quantum computing in energy sector
lead: ​BP has joined the IBM Quantum Network as an Industry Partner to access quantum expertise, software and cloud-based access to the most advanced quantum computers.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Britain ‘edges closer to the power system of the future’ as 2020 is hailed as greenest year
lead: ​Last year was Britain’s greenest yet, with renewables generating more power than fossil fuels for the first time according to a new report from Drax Electric Insights.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Government eyes up options for EV charging regulation in new consultation
lead: ​The government is launching a new consultation on electric vehicle (EV) charging, focusing on improving the consumer experience through four key areas.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Green finance research hubs to open in Leeds and London as government unveils £10m funding
lead: ​The government has unveiled £10 million in funding for new green finance research hubs in a bid to position Leeds and London as “global centres for green finance”.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SSEN brands TNUoS costs 'unfair and volatile' as it calls for reforms to boost renewables
lead: ​SSEN Transmission is calling for views on the current Transmission Network Use of System (TNUoS) charging regime, which it has described as “unfair and volatile”.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energy Company Obligation annual spend to rise to £1bn
lead: The UK government has announced plans to increase spending on its Energy Company Obligation (ECO) to £1 billion per year from 2022-2026 with the aim of increasing energy efficiency for low income and vulnerable households.
author: Edith Hancock

title: Arenko claims first in qualifying non-BMU battery for Dynamic Containment's monitoring requirement
lead: ​Arenko has become the first provider to qualify a non-Balancing Mechanism Unit (BMU) while complying with Dynamic Containment's requirement for real time monitoring.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: National Grid Renewables announces Blake Nixon will take on top role
lead: National Grid Renewables' Daniel Westerman is to step down in April as he takes a new job in Australia.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Have batteries solved the ‘missing money’ problem?
lead: Flexitricity’s Dr Alastair Martin takes a look at how batteries and the Capacity Market have grown over the past decade to meet the so-called “missing money” problem.
author: Dr Alastair Martin

title: EDF made over £7.5m in one day in January as it reacted to tight margins
lead: ​In January, EDF was paid more in three days than it did in Q3 2020, as low winds and cold temperatures pushing National Grid ESO’s ability to balance the system.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Customers adapt EV charging when there are smart incentives finds Shift trial
lead: ​Customers do shift their charging to off-peak times when there are smart charging incentives, the Shift trial has found.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ultra-rapid EV chargers surging in popularity - ZapMap
lead: ​A rise in the usage of ultra-rapid chargers has been recorded by Zap-Map in a new survey of electric vehicle (EV) drivers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Batteries could save £195m annually by providing Reserve finds National Grid ESO trial
lead: ​Using batteries for reserve could save £195 million a year, according to the results of an Arenko led National Grid ESO trial.
author: Molly Lempriere
